title: El après-ski y el pastelito
titleTranslation: The après-ski and the little pastry

thumbnail.generation_prompt: Snowy mountains in Romania, snowboarder in the distance, winter sun, peaceful ski resort.

tags.name: Grammar
tags.description: Past tense (pretérito indefinido, imperfecto), simple connectors, expressing likes and decisions

tags.name: Themes
tags.description: Snowboarding, après-ski, finding your way, making memories

content.text: Una vez fui a hacer snowboard a las montañas de Rumanía.
content.translation: Once I went snowboarding in the mountains of Romania.

content.text: Sabía que hay un après-ski en medio de la pista con pastelitos.
content.translation: I knew there is an après-ski in the middle of the slope with little pastries.

content.text: No sabíamos cómo llegar pero al final alguien nos dijo el camino.
content.translation: We didn't know how to get there but in the end someone told us the way.

content.generation_prompt: Snowboarder looking at a mountain slope in Romanian mountains, winter, looking for the way, snow and trees.

content.text: Encontramos el lugar y bajamos por esa pista.
content.translation: We found the place and went down that slope.

content.text: En una parte la pista era muy empinada y corta.
content.translation: In one part the slope was very steep and short.

content.text: Después a la derecha la pista iba más lento y no daba miedo.
content.translation: Then to the right the slope went slower and it wasn't scary.

content.generation_prompt: Steep short section of a ski slope then easing to the right, snow, winter, dynamic but not scary.

content.text: Llegamos al après-ski pero ya no tenían pastelitos.
content.translation: We arrived at the après-ski but they didn't have little pastries anymore.

content.text: Decidimos que ese trozo de pista era nuestro pastelito.
content.translation: We decided that that bit of slope was our little pastry.

content.generation_prompt: Arriving at a cozy après-ski bar in the mountains, no pastries left, friends laughing, winter atmosphere.

content.text: Desde entonces "ir a por un pastelito" significa bajar por esa pista.
content.translation: Since then "going for a little pastry" means going down that slope.

content.text: Ese recorrido es nuestro pastelito favorito.
content.translation: That run is our favourite little pastry.

content.text: La montaña nos dio algo mejor que un dulce.
content.translation: The mountain gave us something better than a sweet.

après-ski.explanation: Loan word: the bar or place where you go after skiing. Same in English.

pastelitos.explanation: Plural of 'pastelito'. Diminutive of pastel; common word for small sweet baked goods.

empinada.explanation: Adjective (feminine). 'Una pista empinada' = a steep slope. Masculine: empinado.

daba miedo.explanation: Dar miedo = to be scary. 'No daba miedo' = it wasn't scary. Literally 'it didn't give fear'.

trozo.explanation: Noun (masculine). Un trozo de = a piece of. Un trozo de pista = a section of slope.

pastelito.explanation: Noun (masculine). Diminutive of pastel (-ito). Here used in a fun way: the 'little pastry' is the nice run.

significa.explanation: From the verb significar (to mean). 'X significa Y' = X means Y.

dulce.explanation: Noun (masculine). Un dulce = a sweet. Also adjective: sweet (taste).
